subject: RE: [junit] Unable to find DocumentBuilderFactory
msgSnippet: Parser.jar doesn t come with Ant 1.5.1.  Sounds like you have some *old* XML parser stuff mixed in with Ant s newer jars.  I have the default Ant libs, plus
messageBody:
Parser.jar doesn't come with Ant 1.5.1. Sounds like you have some *old*
XML parser stuff mixed in with Ant's newer jars. I have the default Ant
libs, plus jaxp.jar and crimson.jar and that's it (no jaxp.properties).
I believe parser.jar is the Sun XML parser implementation that predates
crimson.

Scott Stirling

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jeremy Mawson [mailto:jmawson@...]
> Sent: Thursday, November 07, 2002 9:22 PM
> To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: [junit] Unable to find DocumentBuilderFactory
>
>
> Greetings
>
> I have recently upgraded to Ant 1.5.1 and this has resulted
> in an odd error in JUnit XML test result logging.
>
> Specifically, JUnit seeks to use
> com.sun.xml.parser.DocumentBuilderFactoryImpl but is unable
> to instantiate it. This class exists in parser.jar.
> Parser.jar exists in Ant's lib directory, but not in the
> dist/lib directory.
>
> Crimson.jar contains another DocumentBuilderFactoryImpl.
> Crimson exists in
> *both* the lib and dist/lib directory. But if I create a
> jaxp.properties file that defines the system property
> javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilderFactory as
> org.apache.crimson.jaxp.DocumentBuilderFactoryImpl then Ant
> fails to run at all... and I don't like this option.
>
> Here is the error I receive when running the JUnit task:
>
> execute-pure-tests:
> [junit] javax.xml.parsers.FactoryConfigurationError:
> com.sun.xml.parser.DocumentBuilderFactoryImpl
> [junit] at
> javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance(DocumentB
> uilderFactory.
> java:75)
> [junit] at
> org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.XMLJUnitResultFor
> matter.getDocu
> mentBuilder(XMLJUnitResultFormatter.java:93)
> [junit] at
> org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.XMLJUnitResultFor
> matter.startTe
> stSuite(XMLJUnitResultFormatter.java:138)
> [junit] at
> org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.JUnitTestRunner.f
> ireStartTestSu
> ite(JUnitTestRunner.java:433)
> [junit] at
> org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.JUnitTestRunner.r
> un(JUnitTestRu
> nner.java:279)
> [junit] at
> org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.JUnitTestRunner.m
> ain(JUnitTestR
> unner.java:524)
> [junit] Exception in thread "main"
> [junit] TEST
> com.qsipayments.business.authentication.AuthenticationCounterT
> est FAILED
>
>
> Has anyone experienced (and resolved) a similar issue?
> Does anyone know how I can configure JUnit (or is it Ant?) to
> find and use a DocumentBuilderFactory implementation?
>
> Regards
> Jeremy Mawson
